crates/fast-ta-experiments/src/data.rs.description: rand 0.8 uses gen() method instead of random() for generating random numbers from ChaCha8Rng. Also need f64 suffix on floating point literals to avoid ambiguous type errors with sqrt().

crates/fast-ta-core/src/error.rs.description: Error enum uses &'static str for context and reason fields. Cannot use String or format!() - must use static string literals.

crates/fast-ta-experiments/benches/e07_e.description: E07 benchmarks reveal plan mode is consistently SLOWER than direct mode (1.5-2.2× slower across all data sizes). This is a critical finding that contradicts the hypothesis that plan mode with fusion would be faster. EMA fusion alone shows only 1.17× speedup. The plan overhead does not pay off with current kernel implementations.

benches/experiments/E02_running_stat/REP.description: E02 RunningStat fusion experiment result: Welford-based fused kernel is 2.8× SLOWER than separate SMA+StdDev passes. The division operation in Welford's algorithm (15-20 cycles) is expensive compared to sliding window approach using additions/subtractions (1 cycle each). Decision: NO-GO - keep separate implementations.

benches/experiments/E03_ema_fusion/REPOR.description: E03 EMA fusion experiment result: NO-GO. Fused EMA computation is 30% SLOWER than separate passes for 10 EMAs at 100K data points. The performance degrades as EMA count increases (opposite of expected). At 20 EMAs, separate is 2.16× faster. Root cause: fused inner loops prevent SIMD vectorization and cause register pressure.

benches/experiments/E04_rolling_extrema/.description: E04 rolling extrema experiment result: CONDITIONAL GO. Deque-based O(n) algorithm is slower than naive O(n×k) for small periods (5× slower at period 5, 1.4× slower at period 14) but dramatically faster for large periods (4.3× at period 50, 24× at period 200, 135× at period 1000). Crossover point is approximately period 20-30. Recommendation: Hybrid algorithm using naive for period < 25, deque for period >= 25.

benches/experiments/E05_plan_overhead/RE.description: E05 plan overhead experiment result: Plan compilation takes only 2.2μs for 9 indicators (500× better than 1ms target). Plan reuse is 0.42ns (essentially free). Break-even is 1 execution with any fusion benefit. Decision: CONDITIONAL GO - plan mode viable but fusion needed for advantage. Without fusion, plan mode is 0.3% slower.

benches/experiments/E06_memory_writes/RE.description: E06 Memory Write Pattern experiment result: NO-GO for buffered/chunked writes. Buffered writes are 19-27% SLOWER than direct writes. Chunked processing is 10% SLOWER. However, interleaved multi-output writes are 2.53× FASTER than sequential passes. Pre-allocation saves 17-28% allocation overhead. Perfect linear scaling to 8 parallel outputs (no memory bandwidth saturation). Recommendation: Use simple write-every-bar with pre-allocation, and interleaved writes for multi-output indicators.

benches/experiments/E07_end_to_end/REPOR.description: E07 End-to-End experiment COMPLETED with NO-GO decision. Plan mode is consistently 1.4-2.2× SLOWER than direct mode across all configurations (7-28 indicators, 1K-1M data sizes). Root causes: Welford fusion 2.8× slower (E02), EMA fusion 30% slower prevents SIMD (E03), buffered writes 19-27% slower (E06). Recommendation: Abandon plan-based architecture, use direct mode for all indicator computations.
